comment.body:
> [@AkioKoneko](https://github.com/AkioKoneko) А можете попользоваться с правилом `://yandex.ru/appcry|` без ограничения приложением? Интересно, как яндексные приложения будут себя вести.

Я то могу, но не думаю, что много статистики соберу. Т.к. живу там, где сервисов яндекс нету, и ничем от них сейчас не пользуюсь на телефоне :c 
Но если решу рабочую почту на яндексе или еще что-то установить, то добавлю правило и протестирую

labels.description: The issue is considered as obsolete

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;

- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

4.9.13

### What type of problem have you encountered?

AdGuard gets detected on a website, Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

other (specify in comment below)

Mobile

https://devuploads.com/8dbqsg2wcglh

### Ad Blocking

### Annoyances

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Hide your search queries, Send Do-Not-Track signals, Self-destruction of third-party cookies, Disable cache for third-party requests, Block third-party Authorization header, Block WebRTC, Block Push API, Block Location API, Hide Referrer from third-parties (specify in comment below, if used custom value), Protect from DPI, Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests

### Add your comment and screenshots

cant download files without disabling adguard app completely. i tried at first to just add the site to my allow list. that does nothing it still detects adguard. i get a totally different screen that shows me the download link if i disable adguard. if i dont it just says checking your download and is stuck there. watch the below videos to understand.

2. with adguard app enabled

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e6306ea2-657a-4040-a95f-d3e7636a9962

issue.title: web.awto.com.br

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [https://web.awto.com.br/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fweb.awto.com.br%2F)
### Comment
> AdGuard Public DNS blocks pages that are used by Awto app to display prices. It is a car rental app in South America.
> 
> It seems the entire subdomain "web.awto.com.br" is blocked. Necessary pages such as https://web.awto.com.br/preco-suvplus/ https://web.awto.com.br/preco-suv/ https://web.awto.com.br/preco-topsedan/ https://web.awto.com.br/preco-cargo/ and others don't work with AdGuard Public DNS.
Username: `@Rikk`

### Screenshots
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/9321fshks7ocw0sckcc4go8sccc48cgmtc9qblw8qs.png?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 2 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/ag75tdyf9eok4sgo04ocww4g40gswg0p19aufhze8g.png?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled</summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/5c99f7sps7ksow8gsgsgww8skcoocgoroylrah29fk.png?nc=1)
</details>

### System configuration

Information | Value
--- | ---
AdGuard product: | AdGuard DNS
DNS setup: | Device or router settings
DNS server: | AdGuard DNS Default server
Browser: | Chrome

comment.body:
Hi @Alex-302 thanks. At least since yesterday it seems to be working fine.

> We don't block this domain

Strange, it wasn't working when using AdGuard Public DNS, but if I changed the DNS to, let's say, 1.1.1.1 or my ISP's DNS, it worked.

issue.title: twitch.tv annoyance "Running ad block? Consider Turbo"
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Mac

### AdGuard version

2.16.3.1867

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.twitch.tv/

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter

### Social Widgets

AdGuard Social Media filter

### Annoyances

AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, AdGuard Widgets filter

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

AdGuard Russian filter, AdGuard German filter, AdGuard Japanese filter, AdGuard Dutch filter, AdGuard Chinese filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. Today while watching any stream a popup started to appear with text
> Running ad block? Consider Turbo.
> Twitch Turbo enables ad-free viewing while still supporting streamers.

There were [news recently](https://www.dexerto.com/twitch/twitch-joins-war-on-ad-blockers-by-hitting-users-with-discouraging-messages-3029595/) Twitch joined ad blocker war.

2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/57b23b67-f567-427b-b780-2401ffe37e41)

</details>

It appears every couple of minutes, very annoying and unusable.

I also have ublock chrome extension, but I disabled it on twitch - didn't help.
<details>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d47a7695-4303-42c3-84a8-9a6f89c7d5b6)

</details>

I also added all known twitch domains to the Adguard white list - didn't help either. Maybe there are some more exist
<details>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5136a0df-901f-4570-80c0-6751942fbd0a)

</details>

### Privacy

- [x] I agree to follow this condition
